question: Which country's human civil rights document is the "Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen"?
explanation: The Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, set by France's National Constituent Assembly in 1789, is a human civil rights document from and inspired by the French Revolution. The Declaration was drafted by the Abbe Sieyes and the Marquis de Lafayette, in consultation with Thomas Jefferson. Influenced by the doctrine of "natural right", the rights of man are to be held to be universal: valid at all times and in every place.
